definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The optimal throw of the dice is to bandy them abroad.
sentences.chinese: 擲骰子最好的點數是丟開。

sentences.english: So Baoyu was left to amuse himself with the other maids at dice or draughts.
sentences.chinese: 因此，寶玉只和衆丫頭們擲骰子趕圍棋作戲。
擲骰子是個不錯的例子。

sentences.english: We ate seafood like shrimps and craps, and drank some abalone soup.
sentences.chinese: 我們吃了海鮮蝦和擲骰子賭博，和喝了一些鮑魚湯。

sentences.english: Quite transparently, they’re rolling the dice in the world’s hottest casino.
sentences.chinese: 相當透明的是，他們正在世界上最火爆的賭場擲骰子。

sentences.english: His son diced himself out of a large fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他兒子擲骰子賭輸了萬貫家財。

sentences.english: They diced away all their money.
sentences.chinese: 他們擲骰子把錢都輸光了。
他們花時間在擲骰子賭博上。

definition: vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
variant of 附會|附会[fu4 hui4]
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
